title-group.article-title: COARSE-GRAINING SCHEMES FOR STOCHASTIC LATTICE SYSTEMS WITH SHORT AND LONG-RANGE INTERACTIONS

abstract.p: We develop coarse-graining schemes for stochastic many-particle microscopic models with competing short- and long-range interactions on a d-dimensional lattice. We focus on the coarse-graining of equilibrium Gibbs states, and by using cluster expansions we analyze the corresponding renormalization group map. We quantify the approximation properties of the coarse-grained terms arising from different types of interactions and present a hierarchy of correction terms. We derive semi-analytical numerical coarse-graining schemes that are accompanied by a posteriori error estimates for lattice systems with short- and long-range interactions.
